task.title: Deleting an aggregate interface
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete an aggregate interface by using the delete aggregate-interface command on the command line. This command removes all member links from the aggregate interface and deletes the aggregate interface definition.

step.cmd: Delete an aggregate interface by entering the following command:
step.info:
delete aggregate-interface interfaceName Where:
interfaceName Specifies the name of the aggregate interface that you want to delete.

taskbody.example: Delete aggregate agg0. All member links are removed from the aggregate interface. Then the aggregate interface definition is deleted.admin@(none)> delete aggregate-interface agg0
